alert.note: Alert for Lewis (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 03 at 8:46AM EST until January 03 at 12:30PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Northeast Kentucky and Ohio, including the following counties, in Northeast Kentucky, Lewis. In Ohio, Adams, Brown, Highland, Pike, Ross and Scioto. * WHEN...Until 1145 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 846 AM EST, radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 1.5 inches are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Portsmouth, Georgetown, Waverly, Mount Orab, West Union, New Boston, Piketon, Peebles, Winchester, Marshall, Sardinia, Seaman, Kincaid Springs, Cynthiana, Belfast, Pike Lake, Lucasville, Rosemount, Clarktown and Higginsport.
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
